definition: to bend or cause to bend, a pitch of a baseball that is thrown with spin so that its path curves as it approaches the batter
details:
verb
- to bend or cause to bend
= example: to bend or cause to bend
= synonyms: crook
- to form a curl, curve, or kink
= synonyms: curl, kink
- to turn sharply
= example: to turn sharply
= synonyms: sheer, cut, swerve, trend, slew, veer, slue
- to form an arch or curve
= example: to form an arch or curve
= synonyms: arch, arc
- to extend in curves and turns
= synonyms: twist, wind
noun
- a pitch of a baseball that is thrown with spin so that its path curves as it approaches the batter
= synonyms: curve ball, breaking ball, bender
- curved segment of a road, river, railroad track etc.
= example: curved segment of a road, river, railroad track etc.
= synonyms: bend
- the property possessed by the curving of a line or surface
= synonyms: curvature
- a line on a graph representing data
- the trace of a point whose direction of motion changes
= synonyms: curved shape
